FuncDef:
The encapsulation nexthop command enables a device to encapsulate the iFIT header in packets destined for a specified next hop IP address.
The undo encapsulation nexthop command disables a device from encapsulating the iFIT header in packets destined for a specified next hop IP address.
By default, a device is disabled from encapsulating the iFIT header in packets destined for a specified next hop IP address.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a next hop IP address for iFIT measurement.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Disables a device from encapsulating the iFIT header in packets destined for all next hop IP addresses.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before using iFIT, you must run the encapsulation nexthop command to enable a device to encapsulate the iFIT header in packets destined for a specified next hop IP address.
If there are multiple next hops, you can repeat this command.
Precautions
Before running the encapsulation nexthop command, ensure that the corresponding next hop has the capability of removing the iFIT header. Otherwise, traffic forwarding on the next hop is affected.
